snippet: Giving up the right to speak and write freely strikes me as the unholiest of deals for a writer to accept.
abstract: Op-Ed article by author Will Blythe describes his opposition to signing nondisparagement clause after he was fired from digital publishing company Byliner; holds giving up the right to speak and write freely, even negatively, is the unholiest of deals for a writer to make.
lead_paragraph: Giving up the right to speak and write freely strikes me as the unholiest of deals for a writer to accept.
